messages.content: What is ComfyUI_FearnworksNodes?
ComfyUI_FearnworksNodes is a collection of custom nodes tailored for specific tasks within ComfyUI.
Which models are these nodes tested on?
These nodes are currently tested on SDXL 1.0 models, with an additional switch needed for handling 1.x models.
How can I install Fearnworks Custom Nodes?
To install Fearnworks Custom Nodes, clone the repository into your ComfyUI custom nodes directory.
What does the CountTokens node do?
The CountTokens node counts the number of tokens in a given text string using the CLIP tokenizer from the transformers library.
What are the inputs for the CountTokens node?
The inputs for the CountTokens node are the CLIP model and the text string.
What is the output of the CountTokens node?
The output of the CountTokens node is the token count as an integer.
What does the TokenCountRanker node do?
The TokenCountRanker node sorts segments and words within a text string by their token count, providing two sorted lists for segments and words.
What are the inputs for the TokenCountRanker node?
The inputs for the TokenCountRanker node are the CLIP model and the text string.
What is the output of the TokenCountRanker node?
The output of the TokenCountRanker node is the sorted text string by token count.
What does the TrimToTokens node do?
The TrimToTokens node trims a text string to include only a specified number of tokens.
What are the inputs for the TrimToTokens node?
The inputs for the TrimToTokens node are the CLIP model, the text string, and the number of tokens.
What is the output of the TrimToTokens node?
The output of the TrimToTokens node is the trimmed text string.
What does the FileCountInDirectory node do?
The FileCountInDirectory node counts the number of files within a given directory, with an option to filter by file type.
What are the inputs for the FileCountInDirectory node?
The inputs for the FileCountInDirectory node are the directory path and the file types to filter by.
What is the output of the FileCountInDirectory node?
The output of the FileCountInDirectory node is the file count as an integer.
